Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the tax increases did not go into effect on January 1, 2015, as stated.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the tax increases by stating that they apply to all individuals, when in reality they primarily affect upper-income taxpayers.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by incorrectly stating the effective date of the tax increases.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific evidence or sources to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all tax increases were passed under the Affordable Care Act, which is not entirely accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide an alternative explanation for the tax increases.
